title: Should schools close for a week in term-time so families can afford holidays? | Meridian
text:
On five days spread throughout the academic year, our teachers are in school - and our children are at home.
So called "Inset days" give staff the chance to keep their skills and knowledge up to to date.
But now there are calls from some to put the school closure days all together so families can beat the term-time holiday ban and save on the cost of holidays.
Brighton and Hove has just received a petition from parents who want all schools in the borough to adopt the idea. Christine Alsford reports
